intro: Oldenlandia leopoldvillensis, commonly known as the Leopold's spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal uses. The plant typically grows as an annual or short-lived perennial, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and usually have five petals with a prominent central tube. It is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves.
